title: Critical Infrastructure Cyber Threat Assessment - Water Treatment Facility
executiveSummary: This assessment evaluates the threat of a cyberattack targeting a water treatment facility's SCADA system. The primary concern is a sophisticated, multi-stage attack aimed at disrupting water supply or compromising water quality through manipulation of industrial control systems.

attackSurface: Internal network vulnerabilities (unpatched systems, weak passwords)
potentialImpact: Disruption of water supply to residential and commercial areas
Compromise of water quality leading to public health crisis
Damage to critical infrastructure equipment (pumps, filtration systems)
Financial losses due to system downtime and recovery efforts
Reputational damage and loss of public trust

indicators: Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
Code overlaps with known nation-state malware

stages.technique: Spear-phishing targeting employees with access to the SCADA network
Exploitation of vulnerabilities in internal network systems
Exploitation of local system vulnerabilities to gain administrator privileges
Direct manipulation of SCADA system parameters (e.g., chemical injection rates, pump speeds)
Exfiltration of sensitive data related to facility operations and security protocols

mitigationRecommendations: Implement multi-factor authentication for all remote access accounts.
Patch all known vulnerabilities in SCADA systems and network infrastructure.
Segment the SCADA network from the corporate network.
Conduct regular security awareness training for employees.
Implement intrusion detection and prevention systems.
Develop and test incident response plans.
